attributes.action: Private-owned car parks on hospital grounds to donate 25% of earnings to NHS
attributes.additional_details: If we have to pay for parking at hospitals the money should be put back in to the NHS. Now more than ever, the NHS needs more funding, and this is a simple way to increase it.
attributes.background: Require privately-owned/managed car parks on hospital grounds to donate 25% of annual earnings to the NHS. This would only apply to properties on hospital grounds, not the company itself.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Donating profits would be a decision for individual companies, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling for any new contracts for parking at NHS sites to include a minimum profit share clause, if that is something you would like to see happen.

You may wish to sign this petition:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330867
